hint.text: Remember that \(\Delta G = \Delta H - T\Delta S\).

solution.text:
\(\Delta G = \Delta H - T\Delta S\)
When \(\Delta G \lt 0 \implies \) reaction is spontaneous.
Therefore, \(\Delta H - T\Delta S \lt 0\)
\(\implies \Delta H \lt T\Delta S\)

content.text: A reaction has a positive \(\Delta S\) as well as a positive \(\Delta H\). Under what conditions can it still be spontaneous?
